conclusion: There are four objects casting shadows on the ground, labeled as A, B, C, and D respectively.
The light source is above these objects and is moving backward.
The position of the shadow depends on the position of the light source and the object.
The size of the shadow depends on the distance between the light source and the object, as well as the distance between the object and the surface where the shadow is cast.
When the light source moves farther away from the objects, the shadows become smaller because the angle of the light rays decreases.
When the light source moves backward, both the distance to the objects and the angle of illumination change.
